Brother Dan Hummel is probably one of his favorite songs. He loves singing that song. And I am, and you are on the winning side. I'm on the winning side. Then my Savior came along and He showed me I was wrong.  say from the straight and narrow way I was drifting every day, out upon the waters deep and wide, so deep and wide, but all is over now, glory light is on my brow, and my soul is on the winning side. Well, I am on the winning side, yes, I am on the winning side. Out in sin no more will I abide, I've enlisted in the fight for the cause of truth and right. Praise the Lord, I'm on the winning side. This morning, if you've been born of God, your life and my life ought to be characterized by love, obedience, and victory. In these five verses of Scripture, we see these three characteristics of those who have been born of God. And I hope this morning that we are demonstrating these things, that the evidence is there, that as we go out into the midst of a perverse and crooked generation, that our lives stand as a beacon of light, proclaiming there's something different about us. And that difference is Jesus, because I've been born of God. Let's pray together. Father, we love You. Oh, how we thank You for loving us. I thank You for the Word of God. I thank You for salvation through the Lord Jesus Christ. Thank You for saving my soul, for changing my life. Thank You for the Holy Spirit of God who lives within. Thank You for the Word of God that You've provided us with. You've been so gracious to give us a Bible. God, we thank You for salvation. We pray that You'd help us to be like Christ. I pray, Lord, that You'd help each one that's here this morning, that's trusted You as their personal Lord and Savior, that they would live a life that's marked by love and obedience and victory. Oh, I pray that today they'd understand their need for Christ. The Holy Spirit of God would convict them of their sin and of Christ's righteousness and of judgment to come. I pray that as we have a few moments of invitation this morning, Lord, I pray that You'd move and work in the hearts of Your people as only You can. We'll thank You for every decision, which in Christ's name we pray. Would You stand with us?
